name: Apple Pie Recipe

ingredients.name: pounds apples, peeled, cored, and each cut into 10 wedges
Basic Pastry Dough for a double-crust pie (see recipe below)
egg, lightly beaten, for egg wash
(6 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
sticks (12 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

recipeYield:
Serves 6 to 8
Active time: 40 minutes
Start to finish: 5 1/2 hours (includes making dough and cooling)Put a large baking sheet on middle oven rack and preheat oven to 425F.Whisk together flour, zest, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and 2/3 cup sugar in a large bowl. Gently toss with apples and lemon juice.Roll out 1 piece of dough (keep remaining piece chilled) on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round. Fit it into a 9-inch pie plate. Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang. Refrigerate while you roll out dough for top crust.Roll out remaining piece of dough on lightly floured surface into an 11-inch round.Spoon filling into shell. Cover pie with pastry round and trim with kitchen shears, leaving 1/2-inch overhang. Press edges together, then crimp decoratively. Lightly brush top of pie with egg and sprinkle all over with remaining 1 tablespoon sugar.  With a small sharp knife, cut 3 vents in top crust.Bake Pie on hot baking sheet for 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375F and continue to bake until crust is golden and filling is bubbling, about 40 minutes more. Cool pie on a rack to warm or room temperature, 2 to 3 hours.Makes enough for a single crust 9-inch pie or a 9- to 11-inch tart, or for a double crust 9-inch pie.
Active time: 10 minutes
Start to finish: 1 1/4 hours (includes chilling)For a single crust pie or a tartFor a double-crust pieBlend together flour, butter, shortening, and salt in a bowl with your fingers or a pastry blender (or pulse in a food processor) just until mixture resembles coarse meal with some small (roughly pea sized) lumps of butter. For a single crust pie or tart, drizzle 3 tablespoons ice water evenly over mixture and gently stir with a fork (or pulse) until incorporated.Squeeze a small handful of dough: if it doesn't hold together, ad more ice water 1/2 tablespoon at a time, stirring or pulsing until incorporated. Do not overwork dough or pastry will be tough.Turn dough out onto a work surface. For a single-crust pie or tart, divide into 4 portions; for a double-crust pie, divide into 8 portions. With heel of your hand, smear each portion once or twice in a forward motion to help distribute fat. Gather all dough together, with a pastry scraper if you have one. For single-crust pie or tart, press into a ball, then flatten into a 5-inch disk. For a double-crust pie, divide in half, and then flatten each into a 5-inch disk. If dough is sticky, dust lightly with additional flour. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm, at least one hour.Cook's note: 
The dough can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.From The Gourmet Cookbook edited by Ruth Reichl (Houghton Mifflin Company, 2004)Print Recipe

Remove from heat and let sit for 10 or 15 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cut a small loaf of rye bread into crouton-sized cubes. In a medium bowl toss a couple handfuls of the rye cubes with the cumin oil until they are nicely coated. Place on a baking sheet in the oven for 15 minutes or so - until the croutons are crisp and starting to brown.

name: Sesame Yogurt Pasta Salad

ingredients.name: a big handful of broccoli florets
a big handful of cauliflower florets
a big handful of green beans, cut into 1 1/2-inch segments
a big handful/scoop of cherry tomatoes, raw or roasted
a small handful torn basil and/or cilantro
Get a big pot of water started - you are going to want to bring it to a boil.

While the water is heating, make the sauce. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, cayenne, and turmeric. Stir well, and saute for just 15-30 seconds, or until the spices are toasted and fragrant. Transfer this mixture to a medium mixing bowl and stir in the water, tahini, yogurt, lemon juice, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Taste and adjust to your liking - you most likely will need a bit more salt. Set aside.

Salt the pot of water generously, and boil the broccoli, cauliflower, and green beans. Boil just 30 seconds, and quickly fish out with a slotted spoon. Run the vegetables under cold water to stop cooking. Drain well and set aside in a large mixing bowl.

Return the water to a boil and add the pasta. Cook until al dente, then drain and run under cold water. Really try to shake off any extra water, then add to the vegetables. Add the tomatoes, and toss gently. You can toss with half of the sauce at this point, or serve the salad with dollops of the sauce on top - to be tossed at the table. It's prettier this way. Sprinkle with the basil/cilantro (and basil flowers if you have them) and serve. Serve the extra sauce on the side - any leftover makes a good dip later in the week.
Adapted from the Pasta Salad with Tangy Sesame-Yogurt Sauce in Peter Berley's The Modern Vegetarian Kitchen.

name: A Good Soup for the Sick

ingredients.name: cloves of garlic, peeled and trimmed
shallots (I might have used a white onion but didn't have one), sliced on the axis into thin crescents
smoked chiles (I used smoked serranos) but I suspect dried chipotles or even one or two chipotles from the can (in adobo sauce) would work nicely
a drizzle of flavorful extra-virgin olive oil
a small handful of cilantro, chopped
a couple (optional) handfuls of a salty hard cheese, Parmesan, grated (I think my mystery cheese was actually Three Sisters Serena)

description: Turn to this miraculously delicious soup when you are feeling sick - beans, water, garlic, shallots, chiles. Total active prep time was under five minutes, the rest is just waiting and anticipating.

name: Egg Salad Sandwich (the only one I'll eat)

ingredients.name: A tiny squeeze of lemon juice

description: The egg salad sandwich recipe I turn to multiple times a week. Light on the mayo, with good quality eggs, chopped celery, and a sprinkling of chives on thinly sliced whole grain bread.

name: Quinoa and Grilled Zucchini Recipe

ingredients.name: couple pinches of fine grain sea salt
a bit of chopped cilantro for garnish

description: A great way to use nutritious quinoa. This quinoa and grilled zucchini recipe is tossed with a pretty, pale green cilantro-flecked avocado dressing.

name: Vegetarian Lentil Burger Recipe

ingredients.name: 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil (or clarified butter)

description: Tasty, hearty vegetarian lentil burger recipe. Slathered with saffron yogurt and stuffed with avocado, lettuce, and onions.

name: Lively Up Yourself Lentil Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: black beluga lentils (or green French lentils), picked over and rinsed
of a big leafy green (chard, kale, etc), rinsed well, deveined, finely chopped
- You can serve it with a poached egg on top,
- with a drizzle of chive infused cream,
- or with chunks of tiny pan-fried butternut squash cubes.
- Make a thicker version by using just a bit of water, and then spoon it over an omelette in the morning.
- Have some cooked farro or wheat berries around? Toss some in. Millet might be good too.
- You can finish the soup by adding your favorite spices or spice blends. Smoked paprika, crushed chiles, toasted cumin, would all work nicely.

description: Healthy, quick, and satisfying this lentil soup recipe delivers layer after layer of flavor. The tang of the tomatoes plays off the earthiness of the lentils, and the fragrant bolt of saffron yogurt brightens each bowl.

name: Big Slurp Dumpling Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: a splash of extra virgin olive oil, plus more to finish
fine grain sea salt, to taste
fresh herbs (chives or dill), see headnotes

description: A quick and delicious dumpling soup - tender, translucent pasta pillows, pale green from their pea-stuffed bellies, are buoyed by yellow lentils in a simple clear broth. Golden puddles of olive oil are suspended across the surface, pooling in various cracks and crevices.

name: TLT Sandwich Recipe

ingredients.name: adobo sauce from a can of chipotle peppers
of tempeh, cut into 1/3-inch thick strips
head of romaine lettuce, cored, then cut into 1/4-inch ribbons
avocados, mashed with a pinch of salt just before assembling
8 extra-thin slices of hearty whole grain bread, well toasted

description: A vegetarian TLT sandwich inspired by the classic BLT sandwich. This version includes chipotle-marinated tempeh alongside oven-roasted cherry tomatoes, a bit of shredded lettuce, and a generous avocado slather on a thin slice (or two) of great bread.

name: Orange Pan-glazed Tempeh Recipe

ingredients.name: freshly squeezed orange juice (3-4 large juicy oranges)
roughly 10 ounces of tempeh (or extra-firm tofu)

recipeYield: Serves 4. (or two if you love it as much as we did -h)
description: The best tempeh recipe I've highlighted to date - it features a simple ginger and garlic-spiked orange glaze that plays of the nutty earthiness of the pan-fried tempeh beautifully.

name: Palak Daal

ingredients.name: / 6.5 oz / 185 g white urid or urad daal, picked over and rinsed
/ 1.5 liters water, plus more if necessary

description: A palak daal recipe from Kasa's Anamika Khanna - a hearty pot of spinach, lentils, and spices. Kasa is a favorite Indian restaurant of mine here in San Francisco.

name: Quesadillas

ingredients.name: a generous dollop of  creme fraiche, sour cream or Greek yogurt
a bit of freshly shaved Parmesan

description: A favorite five-minute lunch quesadilla - corn tortilla, egg, a bit of cheese, fresh herbs, and a dollop lemon-zested Greek yogurt or creme fraiche. The egg helps make it more substantial and extra good.

name: Stuffed Shells Recipe

ingredients.name: / 80 ml extra virgin olive oil, plus more for the pan
scant 3/4 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: A stuffed shells recipe made with lemon zest and bright tomato sauce, and a couple apartment pics.

name: Otsu

ingredients.name: Fresh ginger, cut into a 1-inch cube, peeled, and grated
peeled, cut in half lengthwise, seeded, and thinly sliced
handful of cilantro sprigs, for garnish

description: Soba noodles are tossed with a fiery ginger-sesame dressing and a generous dose of cucumbers, scallions, and pan-seared tofu - it's the sort of recipe you could serve anytime...

name: Spinach Mushroom Quiche Recipe

ingredients.name: whole wheat pastry flour or whole spelt flour
light sesame oil or pure olive oil plus more for brushing the pan
firm tofu, rinsed and patted dry

description: This is a spinach mushroom quiche recipe that features no dairy, no eggs, and no butter. Sounds like it would lack something in the taste department, right? Wrong. It was delicious.

name: Cheesy Potato Spoon Bread

ingredients.name: eggs, beaten, or 1 cup egg substitute
Pepper Jack Cheese, shredded (I used a sharp white cheddar)

description: Outrageously good cheesy potato spoon bread recipe. Warm, tasty, cheesy, crusty, cayenne-kissed, oven-baked goodness. If you are a fan of comfort food - look no further.

name: Spring Sunshine Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: 8 handfuls mixed salad greens or butter lettuce, washed and dried well (I used baby romaine this morning)
2 medium oranges, torn into pieces, pith removed (I used cara cara oranges this morning)
or so toasted nuts (sliced almonds, pine nuts, etc)
extra-virgin olive oil (or half reg. + half lemon oil)
-Gently heat the dressing and toss with spinach, for a warm, slightly wilted dinner salad.
-Use it to toss with pasta (stuffed cheese filled pasta is an especially good choice).

description: A lovely salad recipe utilizing a vibrant citrus and Parmesan vinaigrette. I did a demo of this salad at the San Francisco Ferry Building Farmers Market.

name: Salsa of the Year

ingredients.name: dried mirasol (milder) or smoked serrano (more heat) chilies
garlic, 12 small to medium cloves - peeled

- Stir in 1/3 cup cream (or to taste) - for a slightly creamy sauce that will add a bit of kick to a wide range of recipes. (this is the sauce you see in the pictures on this post). Drizzle on savory crepes, egg dishes, casseroles, etc.
- Stir a couple tablespoons into light or vegan mayo for a spicy sandwich spread.
- Spread on panini: with all sorts of fixings.

description: Smoky and creamy, this salsa recipe is best drizzled over eggs, quesadilla, and crepes.

name: Thousand Layer Lasagne

ingredients.name: fresh egg pasta sheets (or make some from scratch)
balls of fresh mozzarella, torn up into little pieces

description: I'll never make lasagna any other way. Impossibly thin layers of feathery-light pasta with just enough sauce and cheese between each layer to keep it moist and flavorful.

name: A Quartet of Compound Butters

ingredients.name: 2 Numi Desert Lime tea bags (depending on how strong you want it), cut open and the contents ground in a mortar and pestle
organic cane sugar (I used Florida Crystals)
chiles, deveined and  seeded, loosely chopped

description: A quartet of vibrant, colorful, and unique compound butter recipes - Smoked Paprika, Dry Desert Lime, Raw Serrano, and Dehydrated Strawberry.

name: Golden, Crispy Gnocchi with Summer Shell Beans

ingredients.name: fresh shell beans (try a mix of fava, cranberry beans, butter beans), shelled, roughly three cups of beans
chanterelle mushrooms (optional - if you can't get chanterelles, skip the mushrooms)
a few sprigs of fresh thyme, leaves only
a big handful of small cherry tomatoes, halved
clarified butter or extra virgin olive oil

description: My favorite new way to make gnocchi in a flash - no boil. Cook them in a skillet until they are golden and crusted, and in this case serve with summer shell beans and shredded cheese.

name: Ultimate Chickpea Noodle Soup

ingredients.name: water or a mild vegetable stock
pre-soaked ceci beans (also known as chickpeas or garbanzo beans)

description: The ultimate noodle soup recipe - imagine garbanzo beans bobbing about in a rich broth with thick ribbons of pasta noodles weaving in between them, droplets of olive oil suspended on the surface of the broth, and the whole thing punctuated with crisped fresh pasta that had been fried in olive oil.

name: Meyer Lemon Risotto

ingredients.name: lightly pearled barley or pearled farro
Grated zest of 4 Meyer lemons (more to taste if you like)
Handful of toasted pine nuts, for garnish

description: I prefer this barley-based risotto recipe to many other rice based versions - and it is more nutritious. A pearl barley base is accented with white wine, creme fraiche,  lots of meyer lemon zest, chopped greens, and Parmesan cheese.

name: Kale and Olive Oil Mashed Potato Recipe

ingredients.name: potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks
kale, large stems stripped and discarded, leaves chopped
white and tender green parts, chopped

description: My favorite mashed potato recipe - creamy mashed potatoes flecked with finely chopped greens and garlic. Adding a green like kale, and golden threads of drizzled olive oil is a great way to add color and nutritional umph to America's favorite starch-packed side dish.

name: Ultimate Veggie Burger Recipe

ingredients.name: cups sprouted garbanzo beans (chickpeas) OR canned garbanzos, drained and rinsed
Grated zest of one large lemon
micro sprouts, chopped (try brocolli, onion, or alfalfa sprouts - optional)

description: One of my favorite recipes from Super Natural Cooking - this hearty veggie burger recipe is made with garbanzo beans, cilantro, onions, lemon zest, eggs, bread crumbs, and sprouts.

name: My Favorite Grilled Kabob Recipe

ingredients.name: extra-firm tofu, cut into 12 equal-sized cubes

description: A kabob recipe featuring grilled mushrooms, lemons, tofu red onions and a delicious red pepper walnut slather.

name: Farro and Roasted Butternut Squash

ingredients.name: toasted walnut oil (or more olive oil)

recipeYield: Serves 6 - 8 as a side, less as a main.
description: A wonderful farro and roasted butternut squash recipe. Balsamic roasted butternut squash, deeply toasted walnuts, and nutty farro come together in this delicious recipe.

name: Hazelnut & Chard Ravioli Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: swiss chard, deveined and cut into 1/2-inch ribbons

description: Plump raviolis tossed with toasted hazelnuts, sauteed ribbons of chard, and caramelized onions are at the heart of this ravioli salad recipe. The colorful platter is finished off with a dusting of cheese, snipped chives, and lemon zest. You can prepare most of the components ahead of time.

name: Sushi Bowl Recipe

ingredients.name: grated zest and juice of one orange
grated zest and juice of 1/2 lemon
(raw) brown sugar (reg. sugar is ok too)

description: This sushi bowl recipe is simply a de-constructed sushi roll - brown rice, tofu, avocado, toasted nori and green onions served with a citrus-soy dressing. Simple and delicious.

name: Heather's Farro Recipe

ingredients.name: cups peas, fresh if possible boiled for 30 seconds in salted water and drained
a big splash of Citrus Parmesan Vinaigrette***

onions, trimmed, cut in half length-wise, tossed in a bit of olive, sprinkled with a bit of salt and roasted on a baking sheet in a 350F degree oven for about 35 minutes or until browned (toss once midway)

description: A farro recipe I did for my sister's baby shower. Farro, a citrus dressing, roasted spring onions, yellow split peas, fresh peas, a bit of mixed salad greens, and a touch of goat cheese and chives.

name: Spring Panzanella Recipe

ingredients.name: loaf of hearty, day-old, whole wheat bread into 1-inch cubes
fresh thyme - just pluck leaves from the sprig

description: A spring twist on a panzanella recipe. This panzanella features asparagus, spinach, and peas with hearty, garlic and time toasted bread cubes.

name: Harissa Spaghettini Recipe

ingredients.name: a big pinch of fine grain sea salt

description: A unique and flavor-packed pasta recipe. Whole wheat pasta noodles, olives, kale, pine nuts tossed in a pan for a tangle with a garlic-charged harissa and olive oil sauce.

name: Vegetarian Gumbo

ingredients.name: green bell pepper, chopped into 1/3-inch dice
of a great tasting vegetable broth (see head notes!)
green onions, chopped green ends only
cups cooked long grain white or brown basmati rice

description: A vegetarian gumbo recipe taught to me by my friend and neighbor Kim. A rich and delicious gumbo served over rice, and just before serving, eggs are poached in the simmering gravy.

name: Matchstick Pasta Recipe

ingredients.name: bunch of kale, washed, de-stemmed and chopped into bite-sized pieces

description: A great pasta dish using just six ingredients. Whole grain linguine matchsticks and barely cooked red kale are tossed with golden pistachio dressing. Pomegranate seeds provide ruby-colored accents and little pops of sweetness.

name: Giant Chipotle White Beans Recipe

ingredients.name: of large, dried white beans (corona, giant limas, gigantes, or any giant white beans you can find), rinsed, picked over and soaked overnight - or up to 24 hours.
tablespoons adobo sauce from a can of chipotle peppers
kale or chard, washed, de-stemmed, and very finely chopped
queso fresco or feta cheese (see head notes)
cup whole-grain breadcrumbs, toasted in a skillet with a tablespoon of olive oil

description: A riff on Laurence Jossel's fantastic NOPA beans - plump, creamy beans baked in a bright, chunky chipotle tomato sauce, topped with crunchy breadcrumbs, plenty of oozy queso fresco, and an emerald drizzle of cilantro pesto.

name: Jamaican Veggie Patties Recipe
recipeYield: Makes six big patties, or a couple dozen smaller ones.
description: A favorite recipe from chef Bryant Terry's newest book, Vegan Soul Kitchen. A richly spiced potato, pea, corn, carrot, and cabbage filling is wrapped with a turmeric-hued pastry crust made with coconut oil.

name: Okonomiyaki (Japanese Pizza) Recipe

ingredients.name: leeks, well washed and chopped (see head notes)
whole wheat pastry flour (or apf flour)
a couple pinches of fine grain sea salt
Garnish: toasted slivered almonds, chives/ herbs

description: Known in some circles as Japanese pizza, this is my take on okonomiyaki. Plenty of egg-battered cabbage is pressed into a skillet and cooked until deeply golden on both sides. It is served cut into wedges and sprinkled with toasted almonds and chives.

name: Simple Cauliflower Recipe

ingredients.name: 3 heads of small cauliflower (or 1/2 head large)
a couple pinches of sea salt
a bit of flaky sea salt

description: A favorite week-night cauliflower recipe. Tiny florets of pan-fried cauliflower are tossed with garlic, chives, lemon, Parmesan, and flaky sea salt.

name: Orzo Super Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: 10 medium asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch segments
medium head of broccoli (or broccolini), cut into small trees
small handful of cilantro(or mint if you prefer), chopped
clove of garlic, mashed with a big pinch of salt and chopped

description: And orzo salad packed with nutritious ingredients - asparagus, almonds, feta, sprouts, broccoli, cucumber, and a zesty lemon dressing.

name: Almond Soba Noodles Recipe

ingredients.name: pea shoots (or other greens, or tiny pieces of broccoli)

recipeYield: Serves 6-8 as a side, less as a main.
description: A bit of a twist on the peanut noodle salad - this version features soba noodles with a spicy Thai-curry and almond butter sauce, topped with some sauteed tofu and pea shoots.

name: Red Pesto Ravioli Recipe

ingredients.name: a couple big pinches of red pepper flakes
walnuts or pine nuts, lightly toasted
of baby spinach tossed with a glug of olive oil and a big pinch of salt.
a bit of crumbled goat cheese

description: For the sun-dried tomato lovers out there. Goat-cheese raviolis tossed in a sun-dried tomato red pesto sauce, served over baby spinach.

name: Pineapple Rice Recipe

ingredients.name: macadamia oil, olive oil, or sunflower oil
cups cooked brown rice, room temperature
serrano chile, seeded and deveined, and minced (optional)
seitan, cut into little bits and pan-fried (optional)

description: A nice platter of greens and brown rice doused in a spicy-salty-sweet pineapple dressing flecked with seitan. It's good hot or at room temperature.

ingredients.name: a dozen medium cloves of garlic, smashed peeled, and chopped
day-old crusty bread & more olive oil to drizzle

description: In the realm of garlic soup recipes, this is a favorite of mine. From Richard Olney's The French Menu Cookbook, it is made by simmering a dozen or so cloves of garlic in water with a few herbs, then thickening it with a mixture of egg and shredded cheese. It's hard to beat a ladleful poured over some crusty day-old chunks of walnut baguette.

name: Tempeh Curry Recipe

ingredients.name: pounds small waxy potatoes no bigger than a small lime, halved
splash of cream or a dollop of creme fraiche
a small handful of cilantro, loosely chopped

description: A vibrant tempeh curry recipe loosely inspired by a recipe from Lora Zarubin's cookbook, I am Almost Always Hungry.

name: Heirloom Beans & Seitan Recipe

ingredients.name: head of broccoli or broccolini, cut into bite-sized pieces
seitan, sliced into smallish bite-sized pieces
clarified butter or extra virgin olive oil
of your favorite cooked beans (see head notes)
freshly grated Parmesan or Grana Padano

description: This is simply heirloom beans and roasted broccoli with shallots and pan-fried seitan. Something I threw together one night after getting home from the airport. It's filling and hearty, and quick to make - particularly if you have cooked beans stashed in the freezer...but canned beans will work too.

name: Red Posole Recipe

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 453g dried ready-to-cook posole / hominy (see head notes)
red New Mexican chile peppers, stems removed (see head notes)
/ 2 oz / 50g ground red chile (see head notes)

description: A big pot of red posole made on a stormy day. A brick-red brothy sauce surrounds the posole, and individual bowls are topped with thin wisps of pan-fried tortillas, a pinch of toasted Mexican oregano, and a bit of crumbled feta.

name: Feisty Green Beans

ingredients.name: scant 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
/ 120 ml crème fraîche or sour cream
/ one handful of finely chopped fresh cilantro

description: A riff on a recipe from Anna Getty's Easy Green Organic - green beans, creme fraiche, garlic, golden raisins, almonds, a range of spices. They caught my attention when Anna said...the ingredient list is long, but these are the best green beans you'll ever make.

name: Simple Farro & Bean Stew

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 453g  red beans, soaked for at least 4 hours preferably overnight, then drained
/ 800g can whole, peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped
fine grain sea salt to taste
Parmesan and olive oil to serve. Or do what I did with this bowl - whisk together a bit of leftover harissa and some olive oil for a spicier drizzle.

description: I made a big pot of farro & bean stew for my mom and dad the other night - simple, hearty, and straightforward. The stew has farro, beans, lots of vegetables, and a generous dusting of cheese to top each bowl.

name: Turnip Green Tart

ingredients.name: scant 1 cup / 4.5 oz medium coarse corn meal
cups / 10 ounces / 280 g unsalted butter, cut in cubes
/ 4 oz turnip greens, or spinach greens, de-stemmed
scant 1/4 teaspoon salt (more if broth unsalted)
gruyere cheese & a bit of crushed red pepper flakes, for topping
special equipment: tart pans - 9-inch (23 cm) round, 8 x 11 inch (20 x 28) rectangle, or equivalent

description: I'm back from Portland. This recipe was inspired by a bag of chervil, turnip greens, and beautiful heirloom red celery given to me by June Taylor just before leaving. The tart is made with a buttery cornmeal crust, and a mustard-kissed, garlicky, turnip green filling.

name: Grilled Tofu and Soba Noodles

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil, plus a bit more for the tofu
/ 450g extra-firm tofu, drained and patted dry
scant 3/4 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: Soba noodles and grilled tofu tossed with a garlic-cilantro dressing. I prepped all the components for this ahead of a camping trip, but you could take the same approach for a quick, mid-week lunch if camping isn't your thing.

name: Buttermilk Squash Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 450 g potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch cubes
pounds / 40 oz / 1+kg yellow summer squash, cut into 1/2-inch slices

description: A nice way to use up a good amount of summer squash. This soup is a soft, pastel shade of yellow, and aside from a hint of tang from the buttermilk, is quite mild in flavor. I finish it with a cumin brown butter drizzle that punches right through the creaminess, and plenty of chopped chives.

name: Black-eyed Peas & Leeks

ingredients.name: leeks, dark green parts trimmed, quartered lengthwise, then sliced every 1/2-inch

description: From a recipe in Put A Egg On It magazine, issue #2 - Black-eyed peas with lots of caramelized leeks, melted butter, marjoram, and tarragon.

name: Tofu Burger Recipe

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 450 g extra-firm tofu, drained and patted dry, then sliced
/ 2 oz / 55 g fine dried bread crumbs

extras: whatever buns & condiments you like. I did a combination of goat cheese and homemade pickles. You could also do a lettuce wrap in place of buns. And I couldn't resist the mini brioche buns from La Boulange.

description: Seasoned with a good amount of cumin, cayenne and mustard, these are hearty, filling, easy to make, dump-everything-in-the-food processor tofu burgers.

name: Buttermilk Farro Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: head of fennel, trimmed and sliced paper thin
cooked farro, cooled to room temp

description: A buttermilk farro salad inspired by one I had at Clyde Common in Portland, Oregon - farro with shaved radishes, zucchini, and fennel tossed with a tangy herbed buttermilk vinaigrette.

name: Dried Fava Soup with Mint and Guajillo Chiles

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 450g hulled dry fava beans, rinsed (see photo for reference if needed)
/ 2 liters good vegetable broth or water
dried guajillo or pasilla chiles, stemmed & seeded
teaspoon fine-grain sea salt, plus more to taste
/ 2 oz / 55g crumbled Mexican queso anejo or feta

description: Easily one of the best, most interesting soups I've cooked in years. Adapted from a recipe in Rick Bayless's Mexican Kitchen - a dried fava bean and roasted tomato base topped with a fascinating cider-kissed tangy/sweet quick-pickled chile topping.

name: Brown Butter Tortelli

ingredients.name: 3 big handfuls of torn arugula or other bitter/spicy greens
plenty of grated fresh pecorino or Parmesan cheese

recipeYield: Serves 2. You can easily double or triple the recipe to feed more.
description: A few more Rome pics & a simple pasta dish made from ricotta-stuffed tortelli tossed with brown butter balsamic sauce, arugula, pecorino cheese, and lemon zest.

name: Raw Tuscan Kale Salad

ingredients.name: Tuscan kale (for ex: black or lacinato)
slices country bread, or two handfuls good, homemade coarse breadcrumbs
(or small handful) grated pecorino cheese, plus adiitional for garnish
extra-virgin olive oil, plus additional for garnish
Freshly squeezed juice of one lemon (scant 1/4 cup or ~50ml)
Freshly ground black pepper to taste

description: The first thing I made after getting back from Rome. A red chile spiked, shredded raw kale salad tossed in a vibrant, lemony-pecorino dressing. From Melissa Clark's new cookbook, In the Kitchen with A Good Appetite.

name: Ottolenghi Soba Noodles

ingredients.name: scant 1/3 cup / 1.5 oz / 40 g fine-grain natural cane sugar or brown sugar
red pepper flakes or 1/2 fresh red chile, minced
grated zest and juice of one lime
/ 80 ml sunflower oil or olive oil
eggplant/aubergine 3/4 lb / 12 oz, cut into 1/2-inch / 1cm chunks
ripe mango, cut into small chunks
grilled or pan-fried tofu, cut into tiny cubes
a handful of basil leaves, slivered
a handful of fresh cilantro / coriander, chopped

description: Spicy brown sugar and lime-sauced soba noodles with tofu, eggplant, mango and lots of herbs. Inspired by a rare mango find, and a recipe in Yotam Ottolenghi's cookbook, Plenty.

name: Winter Pasta

ingredients.name: bunch of kale - 1/2 lb / 8 oz, stalks removed, washed well
/ 2 oz goat cheese, plus more for topping
fine grain sea salt & freshly ground black pepper

description: I inherited a CSA box packed with greens the other night, inspiring this simple one-pot winter pasta with a sauce made from a full bunch of kale, shallots, garlic, and goat cheese.

name: Mixed Mushroom Chowder

ingredients.name: extra virgin olive oil or clarified butter
assorted fresh mushrooms, cut into bite-sized pieces
fine grain sea salt & freshly ground pepper

description: A big, hearty mushroom soup made with a mish-mash of market mushrooms, pearled barley, toasted sesame oil, and onions.

name: Green Olive Gnocchi Recipe

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil or clarified butter
cup / 200 g green olives, pitted and chopped
store-bought gnocchi, either fresh or packaged
top with: fried capers, bread crumbs, toasted almonds, and/or chives

description: At the heart of this recipe is a completely quirky and off-beat sauce made from pureed green olives. Served with golden, pan-fried gnocchi, capers, toasted almonds and chives. You can easily tweak it to work with pasta or grains as well.

name: Christmas Lima Bean Stew

ingredients.name: OR equivalent cooked beans ~ 2.5 pounds / 1.2 kg*
heads of celery, preferably with leaves, trimmed then sliced into 2 cm / 3/4-inch chunks
OR if spring onions are in season, I use about 12 of those, either way slice into 1/3-inch / 1cm rounds
scant 2 teaspoons caraway seeds, lightly crushed
can whole plum tomatoes, drained, rinsed, cored and roughly chopped
oily black olives, seeded and roughly chopped

description: The soup I've cooked most this year. There is so much going on here despite a modest list of ingredients. Celery, crushed caraway, and garlic are cooked together alongside big hearty beans and chopped tomatoes in what becomes an olive-oil dappled broth. You serve each bowl with chopped oily, black olives and fresh lemon wedges. This is a version made with Christmas Lima beans, but you can substitute cannellini or giant corona beans.

name: Black Sesame Otsu Recipe

ingredients.name: tablespoons shoyu, tamari, or soy sauce
green onions, white and light green parts, thinly sliced

description: The Black Sesame Otsu recipe from Super Natural Every Day - soba noodles and tofu slathered in a thinned-out, salty-sweet black sesame paste, then topped with lots of sliced green onions.

name: Cucumber Peanut Salad

ingredients.name: / 1.5 ounces / 45 g dried large-flake coconut, toasted
ghee, clarified butter, or sunflower oil
scant 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: We picked two new cookbooks to focus on in the 101 Cookbooks Library, and this recipe is inspired by a recipe from one of them. A refreshing chopped cucumber salad loaded with peanuts, spices, coconut, and chiles.

name: Avocado Asparagus Tartine

ingredients.name: slabs of whole grain bread, rubbed with olive oil and a bit of garlic
of asparagus stalks, trimmed roughly the length of your bread
a couple handfuls of arugula, tossed in a bit of olive oil
a handful of toasted pepitas, or almonds, or sunflower seeds

description: An excellent impromptu springtime lunch tartine: avocado smeared across toasted day-old slabs of sesame bread, layered with arugula and garlicky caraway asparagus + toasted pepitas.

name: Sprout Salad

ingredients.name: mung bean sprouts (or equiv. cooked mung beans), about 2 cups
a big handful of well-toasted, sliced almonds

description: One of the best salads I've made in a long time (mung bean sprouts, avocado, arugula, yogurt, almonds) & a look at the QUITOKEETO packaging.

name: Sunchoke and Cashew Stir-fry

ingredients.name: peanut or sunflower oil, plus more if needed
very thinly sliced sunchokes, well scrubbed
soy sauce, plus more to taste
fine grain sea salt and pepper, to taste

recipeYield: Serves 2-3 as a main course, more as part of a larger multi-course meal.
description: A beautiful fried rice made with brown rice, egg, sunchokes, cashews, and basil when Grace Young came over for lunch last week.

name: Lemon-scented Quinoa Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: scant 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: An impromptu quinoa salad recipe made by tossing a quick tahini dressing with chickpeas, red onion, and cilantro.

name: Purple Jasmine Coconut Rice Recipe

ingredients.name: purple jasmine rice (or substitute white jasmine rice)
A handful of cashews, chopped and toasted

description: My favorite coconut rice recipe - rich, fragrant, and just sticky enough.

name: Thai-spiced Pumpkin Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: squash, pumpkins, or other smallish winter squash
fine grain sea salt (or to taste)

description: This Thai-spiced Pumpkin Soup couldn't be easier to make - roasted winter squash, coconut milk, Thai red curry paste, and sea salt come together in a pot of vibrant, rich, flavorful soup. A total crowd pleaser.

name: Vanilla Mashed Sweet Potato Recipe

ingredients.name: pounds sweet potatoes, cleaned and left a bit damp
bean, split lengthwise and seeds scraped
cinnamon stick, crushed, or 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
oil (heidi note: I used olive oil - a mild tasting one) - He uses canola in some of his other recipes.

description: This mashed sweet potato recipe is an all-time favorite, perfect for Thanksgiving. Plump vanilla beans, cream, orange zest, and butter are combined with sweet potatoes that have been roasted in the oven. A quick whirl in the food processor produces a smooth, creamy, subtly sweet puree haunted by the delicious vanilla and citrus undertones. The consistency is that of a thick frosting.

name: Baked Carrot Oven Fries

ingredients.name: a big bunch of farmers' market carrots, washed, trimmed
scant 1 teaspoon adobo sauce from a can of chipotle chiles

description: Made from carrots, this is a healthy, simple and delicious alternative to deep-fried potatoes. These baked oven fries (made from carrots) are simply roasted with olive oil and a sprinkling of sea salt.

name: Lingonberry or Cranberry Jam Recipe

ingredients.name: 2 ounces (500 g) frozen or fresh lingonberries or cranberries
A scant cup (7 oz/200g) of caster (superfine) sugar (hs note: I just gave my regular granulated sugar a whirl in the food processor for 15-20 seconds)
Finely grated rind and juice of 1 lemon

description: A delicious cranberry jam recipe, the most riveting shade of ruby red you've ever seen. Would be perfect with toasted walnut bread and an antique gruyere cheese.

name: Black Pepper and Lime Oven Fries

ingredients.name: pounds small potatoes, cut into wedges

description: A healthy, simple and delicious alternative to deep-fried potatoes. These baked oven fries are finished with salt, pepper, a spritz of lime juice, and a dusting of Parmesan cheese.

name: Delicious Big Bowl - Quinoa Recipe

ingredients.name: a few splashes of extra virgin olive oil
lightly cooked asparagus, cut into 1/2-inch segments
another splash or two of good olive oil or citrus dressing

description: This quinoa recipe shows you how I might clean out my fridge - white quinoa, potatoes, onions, toasted nuts, and asparagus.

name: Ten Minute Tasty Asparagus and Brown Rice

ingredients.name: scant 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
scant 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: A big bowl of asparagus, sauteed garbanzos, chopped onions, toasted almonds, tossed with brown rice and drizzled with a bit of garlic-tahini dressing.

name: Baked Peas with Tarragon, Yogurt, and Pistachios
description: Creamy tarragon spiked yogurt pistachio sauce combined with sweet green peas.

name: Moroccan Baby Carrot Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: baby carrots (or spring carrots), washed and cut into halves and/or quarters lengthwise
black olives (Moroccan, Kalamata, etc), each torn in half
orange syrup (1 cup orange juice reduced by half over medium heat)

description: Carrots tossed in a honey-kissed orange dressing, punctuated by toasted pine nuts, black olives and a hint of cumin.

name: White Bean Salad

ingredients.name: handfuls baby spinach, washed and dried
white cannellini beans (or freshly cooked equivalent)
a couple glugs of citrus-flavored olive oil
a small splash of champagne vinegar
a few pinches fine-grained sea salt
a bit of crumbled cheese (manouri, goat cheese work nicely)

description: A tasty white bean salad topped with toasted walnuts, crumbled cheese, and a hint of citrus. Makes a good side dish, a satisfying lunch, or light dinner.

name: Fourth of July Roasted Tomato Salsa Recipe

ingredients.name: Roma tomatoes, cut in half lengthwise
white onion, cut into six wedges
a couple pinches of finely ground sea salt
dried guajillo chile pepper, soaked in boiling water until softened, and then drained

description: A deliciously vibrant, earthy, and slightly smoky-tasting salsa recipe. Different from salsa fresca, the deep, caramelized flavors of the roasted tomatoes and onions alongside the smokiness of the chipotles make for a richly beautiful and balanced salsa.

name: Rosewater Plum Compote Recipe

ingredients.name: sugar (I used fine-grain organic cane sugar)

recipeYield: Makes about eight 1/2-pint jars of compote.
description: A stunning jewel-colored rosewater plum compote. It  can make ordinary french toast, waffles, pancakes, and crepes, and vanilla ice cream extra special.

name: Spinach and Zucchini Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: cups potatoes (2 medium)  cut into 1/2-inch cubes

description: Simple and delicious, vibrant green spinach and zucchini soup recipe. Light-and-healthy, but still creamy textured and plenty tasty.

name: Espresso Caramels Recipe

ingredients.name: espresso powder / finely ground espresso beans

recipeYield: Makes 1 1/2 dozen nut caramels, or a couple dozen individual caramels (depending on the size).
description: A favorite caramel recipe yielding dozens of generously espresso-flecked caramels that you can individually wrap. They have a deliciously subtle undercurrent of sea salt and are great for the holidays.

name: Golden-Crusted Brussels Sprouts Recipe

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for rubbing
fine-grain sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

description: A quick and easy brussels sprouts recipe that will convert the biggest skeptics. Vibrant green, tender brussels sprouts that become deeply golden and crusty where they touch the pan, dusted with cheese.

name: Butter-toasted Hazelnut Recipe
description: One of my favorite party-friendly ways to use hazelnuts. This butter-toasted hazelnut recipe uses toasted butter, fresh tyme and lemon and orange zest to add a simple yet sophisticated twist to a nut bowl.

name: Poached Eggs Over Rice

ingredients.name: pinch of crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
3 cups dark leafy green, deveined and finely chopped
3 cups pre-cooked whole grain rice (brown is fine)

description: An unassuming yet satisfying little rice bowl recipe - simply a reasonable serving of chard-flecked whole grain rice topped with a poached egg.

ingredients.name: cups white beans, precooked or canned (drained & rinsed well)

more good-quality extra-virgin olive oil for drizzling

description: Hearty, healthy, and satistfying - this cabbage soup recipe is super simple to make. Slice a cabbage into thin ribbons and cook it down in a simple pot of sauteed potatoes, onions, beans, garlic and flavorful broth. Finished each bowl with a generous drizzle of great olive oil and a dusting of shredded cheese.

name: Caramelized Tofu Recipe

ingredients.name: 8 ounces extra-firm tofu cut into thin 1-inch segments (see photo)
a couple pinches of fine-grain sea salt
a couple splashes of olive or peanut oil
fine-grain natural cane sugar or brown sugar
brussels sprouts, washed and cut into 1/8-inch wide ribbons

recipeYield: Serves 2 - 3 as a main, 4 as a side
description: One of my favorite tofu recipes, caramelized strips of tofu served over sauteed shredded brussels sprouts. It come together quickly and uses just one pan.

name: Vegetarian Split Pea Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: dried split green peas, picked over and rinsed
a few pinches of smoked paprika

description: A delicious, healthy, textured split pea soup recipe made from an impossibly short list of ingredients. Vegetarian, no ham hocks in this version.

name: Garam Masala Tofu Scramble Recipe

ingredients.name: onion, halved and cut into thin slices
bulb fennel, cut into very thin slices

description: A favorite (and quick) tofu scramble recipe using shaved fennel, caramelized onions spices and dried fruit, and then counter-balancing those flavors with cilantro and chopped nuts.

name: Yellow Split Pea Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: dried split yellow peas, picked over and rinsed

description: Healthy, beautifully textured, and colorful this split yellow pea soup makes for a terrific lunch. The yellow split pea soup base is topped with a tzatziki-inspired yogurt dollop, a touch of mint, a spoonful of finely chopped black olives, and a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Spring Wild Rice Salad Recipe

ingredients.name: scant 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt
asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch segments

description: A spring-inspired wild rice salad - vibrant asparagus, yellow split peas, and wild rice tossed in an almond butter dressing and finished off with a bit of goat cheese and chives.

name: Sunburst Carrot Salad Recipe
description: A favorite carrot salad recipe - carrot ribbons sauteed in a bit of salt and olive oil and finished off with lemon zest, finely chopped serrano chiles, a quick squeeze of lemon juice, and lots of cilantro.

name: Cumin-spiked Tofu Recipe
description: Slabs of tofu marinated in a cumin, garlic, yogurt slather and cooked on a grill or in a grill pan or skillet.

name: Ottolenghi Red Rice and Quinoa Recipe

ingredients.name: grated zest and juice of one orange

description: Ottolenghi's beautiful red rice and quinoa recipe - a substantial, color-flecked platter showcasing citrus-dressed grains punctuated by pistachios, dried apricots, and arugula.

name: In a Hurry Green Curry Recipe

ingredients.name: of firm tofu cut into 1/2 inch cubes

description: A quick and delicious green curry recipe - peas, asparagus, and tofu swimming in a fragrant, not-overly-rich Thai green chile broth.

name: Lime & Peanut Coleslaw Recipe

ingredients.name: of tiny cherry tomatoes, washed and quartered

description: This feather-light, mayo-free, coleslaw recipe uses toasted peanuts, cherry tomatoes, and lime vinaigrette and is perfect alongside fajitas, or whatever you have coming off the grill. Keep in mind - great coleslaw is rooted in great knife skills.

name: Spinach Rice Gratin Recipe

ingredients.name: cups leftover/pre-cooked brown rice, room temp
cups cups well finely chopped spinach
shredded Manchego cheese (or Parm, or Gruyere)

description: A delicious rice gratin recipe - a hearty casserole of baked rice flecked with spinach. The top bakes into a golden cheese crust made even better with a generous sprinkling of black olives, red onions, and toasted pine nuts.

name: Edamame Soup Recipe

ingredients.name: peeled and cut into small cubes,
- see headnotes for garnish you see in photo

description: Charlotte's edamame soup  recipe was a big hit with Wayne - a bit of olive oil, potato, frozen edamame beans, and vegetable stock come together to make a satisfying, protein packed bowl, of pale green tastiness.

name: Lemon Achiote Grilled Tofu Recipe

ingredients.name: package of extra firm tofu, cut into 4 slabs

name: Curried Bean Salad Recipe

And while I like to cook my beans from their dried state, this is a forgiving salad and canned beans that have been well rinsed will work too. You can serve this salad hot or at room temperature, whatever your preference.
red onion, thinly sliced into crescents
teaspoons of your favorite curry powder
teaspoons freshly grated ginger (from 1-inch cube of fresh ginger, peeled)

description: This bean salad recipe salad features pretty heirloom beans along with a few black lentils, splashed with a brightly-flavored ginger-curry vinaigrette.

name: Lemony Chickpea Stir-fry Recipe

ingredients.name: onion or a couple shallots, sliced
cooked chickpeas (canned is fine, if you don't want to cook up a pot of dried chickpeas)
zest and juice of 1/2 a lemon

cooked quinoa* (or brown rice, or other grain)
cups kale, spinach or other hearty green, finely chopped

halved top to bottom and sliced into thin crescents

green beans, tops and tails trimmed and cut into 1-inch segments

Extra toppings (optional) freshly grated Parmesan, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, fresh chives or fresh thyme.

of loosely packed fresh cilantro, chopped

- olive oil, toasted sesame oil, or red chile oil for a finishing drizzle - if you use toasted sesame oil (sometimes labeled pure sesame oil) it is very strong. I typically dilute it with olive oil. I use one part sesame oil to four parts olive oil.

ingredients.name: (2 lb.) acorn squash, cut in half lengthwise and seeded

You then bake it until the filling sets, and finish with white cheddar cheese left under the broiler until golden and bubbly.

The back notes of ginger, slivered green onions sauteed in butter, and curry-plumped raisins make this a new favorite of mine.

name: Hummus with Green Goo

ingredients.name: / 453 g dried chickpeas, soaked in water for at least 4 hours, drained

scant 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

description: A light, almost billowy, hummus topped with

It's a bean and noodle soup at its core featuring thin egg noodles swimming in a fragrant broth spiced with turmeric, cumin, chiles, and black pepper. You use a medley of lentils, chickpeas, and borlotti beans which makes the soup heart and filling without being heavy. You add spinach, dill, and cilantro. You add lime juice for a bit of sour at the end. And then you've got a number of toppings to add when you serve the soup - chopped walnuts, caramelized onions, and sour cream. Amazing.

Jamaica Flower Iced Tea Recipe

name: A Nice Berry Pie

ingredients.name: You can make the crust using the quick and popular food processor technique. BUT I always make it by hand, using the above ingredients, and this technique. If you like a super-puffy crust, do the folding in Pim's instructions 4x. I usually like mine less so, and fold & roll just 2 or 3 times, depending on how the dough is feeling. The pie in the photo was 3x.
/ 3.5 oz / 100g natural cane or brown sugar

Preheat your oven to 425F / 220C, with a rack in the bottom third. Roll out your pie crust - top and bottom - on a flour dusted counter. I tend to work the edges a bit first (particularly if I'm getting cracks) - roll and turn, roll and turn, dusting with flour when necessary. Flip once or twice. Work quickly and keep the dough moving. Place between unbleached parchment paper or Silpats, and refrigerate while you make the filling. If you're nervous about rolling out the crust, have a look at the second part of Melissa Clark's video. See how she's not super fussy? Channel some of that. If you need an extra confidence booster, read this. It's o.k. if your dough doesn't roll out into a perfect circle - you can patch and pinch later if needed. Just shoot for 11 or 12-inch inch rounds.
Make the filling by combining the sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, and thyme in large mixing bowl. Add the berries, and toss gently until well combined. Set aside.

Line a 9 or 10-inch pie plate with the bottom piece of pie dough. Guide it into place without stretching. You want about an inch of dough extending past the rim of the pie plate, trim a bit with scissors or a sharp knife if needed.

Fill the crust with the berries, drizzle with lemon juice, and dot with the butter. Brush the rim of the bottom crust with a bit of egg wash, then top with the other piece of pie crust. Trim the top crust a bit if needed, then press the top and bottom crusts together at the edges. Working around the rim, tuck the overhanging dough under itself, and crimp with a fork or flute using your fingers (see picture up above). Brush the crust with more of the egg wash, cut a few slits into the top, and place in the oven for about 45 minutes - until the crust is deeply golden. Check your pie regularly after 25 minutes. If you need to foil the edges of the pie - pull it out and do so - this way the edges wont get too dark and dry. I don't have to foil in my oven for this pie, even at this temp, but your oven might be a bit different. I also sprinkle with large-grain sugar about 25 minutes in - for a little extra crunch and sweetness. Let cool a bit, slice and serve.

tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/4-inch pieces

description: Made from polenta, buttermilk, cayenne pepper, and Parmesan cheese, this is a perfect party cracker recipe.

name: Baked Artichoke Dip Recipe

ingredients.name: fine grain sea salt, or more to taste
more Parmesan to sprinkle on top

description: An updated, healthier version of my favorite artichoke dip recipe. Artichokes pureed with yogurt, tofu, Parmesan cheese, and garlic and baked until golden.

name: Olive Oil Cracker Recipe

ingredients.name: cups white whole wheat flour (or all-purpose flour)

recipeYield: Makes a dozen extra large crackers.
description: This cracker recipe makes thin, snappy, rustic crackers - sturdy enough to stand up to a hearty dip. The technique is simple and straightforward (utilizing just a few ingredients) and the dough is a welcoming canvas to all manner of seeds, salts, cheeses, spices, or flavored oils that you might want to use as accents.

name: Plump Pea Dumpling Recipe

ingredients.name: (about 10 ounces) cups peas (freshly shelled or frozen)
scant 1/2 tea spoon fine grain sea salt
of wonton wrappers, or round wrappers
special equipment: bamboo steamer (or see head notes for alternative cooking method)

description: A vegetarian dumpling recipe featuring a simple pea, lemon, ricotta filling. Bright flavors and delicious steamed or pan-fried.

name: Grilled Pizza Recipe

ingredients.name: I've had success with White Whole Wheat Pizza Dough or  Peter Reinhart's Napoletana Pizza Dough recipe.
- my favorite five minute tomato sauce

- caramelized fennel & olives:  Made by slicing fennel thinly, but not paper thin (a mandolin does the job). In a large skillet over med-high heat,  saute the fennel in olive oil for 3 or 4 mins, to brown a bit. Turn down the heat to low and cook for another fifteen to twenty minutes. A few minutes before the fennel is done, toss in a handful of your favorite pitted olives.

description: Grilled pizza recipe with an outline of techniques and considerations about the technique it takes to get grilled pizzas right - with topping ideas.

name: Apple Zucchini Crostini Recipe

ingredients.name: whole grain bread, very thinly sliced
tiny splash of milk or cream
splash of extra virgin olive oil
apple, cut into 1/4 inch dice (place in a bit of lemon water if not using immediately)
a bit of freshly ground black pepper

description: Inspired by a trip to Argentina, small crackers topped with an apple-zucchini relish, a tiny kiss of goat cheese, and a couple flecks of black pepper.

name: Hummus en Fuego Recipe
description: A beautiful, spicy hummus recipe made from pureed garbanzo beans, toasted walnuts, and spicy crushed red pepper oil finished with a few chopped olives and a bit of cilantro.

name: Caramelized Onion Dip Recipe

ingredients.name: sour cream (low-fat is fine if you like)
Greek yogurt (low-fat is fine if you like)

description: A grown-up remake of the onion dip I loved as a kid. This one features lots of deeply caramelized onions, sour cream and Greek yogurt.

name: Classic Cheese Fondue Recipe

ingredients.name: Gruyere cheese, shredded (or 1/2 lb Gruyere + 1/2 lb Emmental cheese)
A splash or two of kirsch (opt)
premium semisweet or bittersweet chocolate, well chopped

description: A classic cheese fondue recipe. I've included dozens of my favorite things to dunk - don't limit yourself to just bread!

name: Monica Bhide's Chile Pea Puffs

ingredients.name: nonstick cooking spray (HS note: or a bit of olive oil)
green serrano chiles, minced (remove seeds to reduce heat)
red chile powder or red chile flakes (less to reduce heat)

description: Monica Bhide's Chile Pea Puff recipe - crispy-skinned baked snacks stuffed with peas, paneer cheese, chiles, and garlic. From her new cookbook - Modern Spice: Inspired Indian Flavors for the Contemporary Kitchen.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Falafel Recipe

ingredients.name: sweet potatoes (orange inside), around 700g or 1 1/2 pounds in total

description: Baked Sweet Potato Falafel recipe from the Leon cookbook -made from mashed sweet potatoes, chickpea flour, spices, a nice amount of garlic and plenty of chopped cilantro.

name: Buckwheat Cheese Straws

ingredients.name: (4 ounces) unsalted butter, cold, cut into 1/4-inch cubes
(2 1/2 ounces) white cheddar, shredded on a box grater

description: These cheese straws look like wispy tree branches. Wayne calls them cheese twigs, and they never last very long around here. Crispy, cheddar-flecked, and rustic - it's the buckwheat flour that lends these slender creations their convincing shade of brownish gray.

name: Grilled Salt & Vinegar Potatoes

ingredients.name: / 16 oz / 450 g waxy potatoes (see head notes), cut into 1/4-inch slices
flaky sea salt, plus more for seasoning

description: Salt & vinegar chip enthusiasts, these are for you. You take slabs of sliced potatoes, boil them in vinegar, then grill them to a crisp. Not for the faint of heart, or anyone with particularly sensitive taste buds ;)...

name: Oatmeal Crackers

ingredients.name: cups / 300 ml whole milk, heated just to boiling
cups / 6.75 oz / 190g  all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

description: Snappy, substantial, homemade oatmeal crackers - made with rolled oats and rye flour. Plus a little glimpse at some postcards I made.

name: Liptauer Cheese Crostini

ingredients.name: pinches of salt, or to taste
a few dozen thin crostini or crackers*
one bunch of chopped chives, to serve

description: A couple book signing pics. And in an effort to expand my crostini repertoire, I made this flavor-packed liptauer cheese spread on black bread crostini - goat cheese, paprika, capers, pickles, onions.

name: Golden Potstickers

ingredients.name: onions / scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced
serrano chiles, thinly sliced, or to taste
sunflower oil, plus more for pan-frying
fine grain sea salt, or to taste
/ 11 oz / 310 g cooked yellow split peas, ideally at room temperature, then process in a food processor until uniform and fluffy

recipeYield: Makes a big platter of dumplings.
description: Potstickers - For my flight to London,  I made the filling with lots of caramelized shallots & pureed yellow split peas then pan-fried them until the bottoms were crisp and golden. They freeze like beautifully, perfect for quick dumpling-centric meals later on.

name: Gougères

ingredients.name: scant 1/2 cup / 65 g / 2.25 oz all-purpose flour
scant 1/2 cup / 65 g / 2.25 oz whole wheat flour
cup / 3 1/4 oz / 90 g sharp white cheddar, grated on box grater
fennel seeds, crushed w/ mortar + pestle

description: Gougères - I have these little cheese puffs in my freezer, ready to bake, nearly always. This version, a favorite, is made with whole wheat flour, sharp white cheddar cheese, fennel, and ale.

name: Parmesan Cheese Spread

ingredients.name: cups / 5 1/2 oz / 150g finely grated Parmesan cheese
scant 1/4 cup / 50 ml extra virgin olive oil
add in ideas: chopped dried figs, chopped dates, finely lots of chopped chives, lemon zest, or red pepper flakes, dried herbs, chopped sun-dried tomatoes

description: A Parmesan cheese spread made with grated cheese, olive oil, a splash of white wine, and any other accents you can think of.

name: Mast-o-Khiar Yogurt Dip

ingredients.name: a dozen fresh mint leaves, chopped

description: The prettiest dip in my repertoire - my take on the Iranian preparation of Mast-o-Khiar (yogurt and cucumber). I use lots of fresh herbs, dried rose petals, toasted walnuts and a pop of added color and tartness from dried cranberries.

name: Fennel Mushrooms

ingredients.name: a few pinches fine grain sea salt
bulb of fennel, trimmed and sliced very thinly
a small bunch of chives, minced
a small bunch of watercress, sorrel, or arugula

description: A fennel mushroom recipe inspired by one of my vintage cookbooks, The Seasonal Kitchen by Perla Meyers. It's a simple, brilliant twist on everyday sauteed mushrooms with dill, chives, fresh fennel, and a kiss of creme fraiche.
